commit.message: changesets: only require lively.ChangeSet when "LivelyChangesets" are in localstorage
worker: Functions.forkInWorker has better logging
ide, code snippets: state network dependency
canvasmorph: add tests to default test files

commit.message: new shortcuts: gotoNextParagraph (Ctrl-Down), gotoPrevParagraph (Ctrl-Up), moveCursorToScreenTop (Ctrl-Alt-,), moveCursorToScreenBottom (Ctrl-Alt-.)

Merge branch 'vwf-compat'

Conflicts:
	core/lively/ChangeSets.js
	core/lively/ModuleSystem.js
	core/lively/persistence/BuildSpec.js

+  <script type="text/javascript" src="core/lively/bootstrap.js"></script>

+      fill: "Color.blue"
+      borderWidth: 2

+- |

commit.message: prev/next paragraph shortcut fix
network: some cleanup
worker: Firefox compatibility
bootstrap: cleaning script load logic
bootstrap: remove css load nonsense

ide: completions are again computed in worker code. This won't prolong loading and will use all avaiable sources for word completion computation. Eventually this will be moved into a subserver.

reverts part of #9d131d7 and #1fc1ba3
bootstrap: allow JS scripts to be loaded via script tags again. This fixes cross-domain code loading and JSONP support. Also remove Global.livelySources as it is not used by completions anymore
ide: config setting to control whether to use codeeditor completions

files.patch:
@@ -407,7 +407,7 @@ Config.addOptions(
 
     // Modules
     ["modulesBeforeWorldLoad", ["lively.morphic.HTML"], "evaluated before all changes"],
-    ["modulesOnWorldLoad", ["lively.ide", "lively.IPad", "lively.net.SessionTracker", "lively.net.Wiki", "lively.ide.codeeditor.Completions", "lively.ChangeSets"], "evaluated before world is setup"],
+    ["modulesOnWorldLoad", ["lively.ide", "lively.IPad", "lively.net.SessionTracker", "lively.net.Wiki", "lively.ChangeSets"], "evaluated before world is setup"],
     ["codeBase", Config.codeBase && Config.codeBase != '' ? Config.codeBase : Config.getDocumentDirectory()],
     ["showModuleDefStack", true, "so modules know where they were required from"],
     ["loadUserConfig", true, "for sth like jens/config.js, used in lively.bootstrap"],
@@ -492,6 +492,7 @@ Config.addOptions(
     ['aceDefaultEnableAutocompletion', true, "Should autocompletion be enabled?"],
     ['aceDefaultShowWarnings', true, "Should autocompletion be enabled?"],
     ['aceDefaultShowErrors', true, "Show syntax errors in programming language mode?"],
+    ['computeCodeEditorCompletionsOnStartup', true, 'when enabled all JS files udner core/ are read on startup nd their content is used to compute word completions'],
     ['showDoitErrorMessages', true, "When a doit eval results in an error a error message pops up."],
     ['improvedJavaScriptEval', false, "Eval that changes semantics of how object literals and if statements are evaluated."],
 ],

commit.message: bootstrap: remove forgotten livelySources
firefox compat: improve key recognition of Firefox
dialogs: when multiple dialogs are chained remember last focused morph correctly
shell: fix persistent command escape
ide/directory viewer: fix menu item invocation
persistence: deal with typed arrays

SourceCodeBrowser:
patches to alleviate reuse of the BrowserFramework, and to allow for history browsing

- added readme explaining what and why the browser framework does what it does
- prohibit creating multiple views for one browser object
- only register SystemBrowser with SourceControl, not all BasicBrowsers created
- check for 'undefined' in more places
- set the parent field for subnodes of CompleteFileNodes
serialization: catch deserialization of null objects
better error message

History Code Browser Addon:
refactoring of the installation to allow later changes to the configuration. This also unifies the two occurences of system wide installation.

lively.binding.showConnection:
refactoring of the hiding code, to be able to call it from other places as well
smaller changes to make the code less brittle

History Browser Addon:
    When used, allows back and forward navigation in the SystemBrowser. To install either load file during world startup and set the 'useHistoryTracking'-option to true, or use the PartsBin/Tools/HistoryBrowserAddon (which also allows for single window modification).
Changed OMetaWorkspace starting string to avoid future problems when trying to learn OMeta using that workspaces example (using matchAll instead of match)
persistence: clean up typed arrays after deserializing
preserve debug information at least when saving the whole file
merge, some fixes, use namespaced names
